Out of interest, why are you using "follow inclusions for Outline View"?
That mode is off by default, as it does not scale well and hasn't been 
completely 100% tested.  

Can you send us the offending source code or is it proprietary?

code is proprietry sorry.

I like to test new features out. Are you saying that if I switch that option 
off I will not get these stack overflows that corrupt my workspace?

Yes, if you switch that option off, you will get both better perfomance, and 
fewer fatal exceptions.

As for the stack trace, it looks like code something like the following:
template < class T > class A : public A< T* > {};
A< int > a;
will cause it, however, the compiler will also choke on this so I don't think 
this was the cause for you.

Any fix for the above snippet might stop the stack overflow for your case, but 
if your code compiles then there is another bug that I'm missing that will 
remain unfixed unless you can provide a code pattern that causes it.

I've flatten out the recursive loop into something that won't use up the stack.
I've also put in a loop counter to stop looping after a bit (10 iterations)
Its impossible to tell the difference between a legitamite recursion and a loop 
like this, but I think that 10 iterations is high enough to not get false 
positives.
